Title.evidence: Methods:: Randomized controlled trial at a single tertiary care center.

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned in a 1:1 fashion to either perioperative CT via a mobile device or a usual care control.

Participants.evidence: Participants included 45 older adults age 60–90 undergoing cardiac surgery at least 10 days from enrollment.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned in a 1:1 fashion to either perioperative CT via a mobile device or a usual care control.

Objective.evidence: We sought to determine the feasibility and potential efficacy of a perioperative CT program to reduce the incidence of postoperative delirium and POCD in older cardiac surgery patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome of feasibility was evaluated by enrollment patterns and adherence to protocol.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned in a 1:1 fashion to either perioperative CT via a mobile device or a usual care control.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants included 45 older adults age 60–90 undergoing cardiac surgery at least 10 days from enrollment.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The incidence of postoperative delirium (CT group 5/20 [25%] versus control 3/20 [15%]; P = .69) and POCD (CT group 53% versus control 37%; P = .33) was not significantly different between groups for either outcome in this limited sample.
